mods.note: BOMBAY GOVERNMENT GAZETTE EXTRA O R D I • j j u in i $!) r a i) y & u 11) o r i t y. THURSDAY, 22 nd AUGUST 1850. PROCLAMATION. GENERAL DEPARTMENT. 1. The Right Hoivblethe Governor in Council regrets to announce, that bv the Over land Mail, which arrived yesterday, intelligence has been received of the Death of His Roval Hi o-hness. Adolphus Frfdetuck, Duke of C \mbridge. O 7 2. His Lordship in Council directs, on this melancholy occasion, that the Flag- at the Castle be hoisted Half-mast-high, and continue^so till sunset; and that Minute Guns, to the number of 76, corresponding with the age of the deceased Prince, be fired from the Garrison, on the Flag being hoisted; that the same ceremony be observed by the Honorable Com pany's Cruizers in the Harbour. The Minute Guns being taken up, tm the termination of those from the Garrison, and continued under such directions as the Commander in Chief i of the Indian Navy may issue. 3. The Flag to be hoisted Half-mast-high, and 76 Guns to be fired at every Station subordinate to this Government, on the receipt of these orders. 4. His Lordship in Council directs, on this melancholy occasion, that Mourning be worn by the Officers of Her Majesty, and the Hon'ble Company's Civil, Military, and Marine Services at this Presidency, for a period of 10 days from this date, an example which he trusts will be generally followed by all classes of Her Majesty's subjects residing under the Presidencv of Bombay. J J •By order of the Ilight Honorable the Governor in Council, J. G. LUMSDEN, Secy, to Govt. Bombay Castle, ^nd August 1850.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 3334: J G Lumsden, Secretary to Government at Bombay, to Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf at Bushire

mods.abstract: In this letter, received 6 December 1850, Lumsden transmits a copy of a printed notification, issued 22 August 1850 by the Bombay Government, which announces the death on 8 July 1850 of His Royal Highness the Duke of Cambridge. The notification includes directions on mourning.
